result.execSummary:
The defendant Charles EA Franken was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Fine and costs to be paid in 30 days, or serve 12 days jail consecutive as penalty for non-payment.
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided,   immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Charles EA Franken

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Charles EA Franken in court.  Bryan C. Bayer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.     The Defendant has not retained an attorney at this time but is instructed by the Court to apply at the public defender's office and return back to court.
The Court recalls the came with the same appearances.  The Defendant does not qualify for representation through the public defender's office.  The Case is again recalled by the Court with the same appearances.  The Defendant is sworn in and the Court finds the Defendant is competent to represent himself.    Defendant enters a plea of no contest to Count 1  Court finds defendant guilty.  The Defendant was sentenced as follows:
Count #1:
FINE: $379.00 (to be paid in 30 days or serve 12 days jail consecutive as penalty for non payment).
DNA SURCHARGE: $200.00 (to paid in 30 days)
  Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided,   immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.   Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.

ADDRESS INFO for Charles EA Franken
Current: 328 Maple Avenue #202, Waukesha, WI 53186 United States  (Effective: 02-11-2016)
Prior: W228 S9020 Jackson Pkwy, Big Bend, WI 53103

Defendant Charles EA Franken in court.  Barbara Ann Michaels appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Court advises of right to an attorney.   Defendant to apply at Public Defender's Office for representation.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT.
  Hearing scheduled for March 14, 2016 at 09:00 am.
Defendant Charles EA Franken not in court.  Kristi J Gordon appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
